org.contentmine.image.colour

Class ColorAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.contentmine.image.colour.ColorAnalyzer

  • public class ColorAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
    from Boofcv public class ColorHsv extends java.lang.Object Color conversion between RGB and HSV color spaces. HSV stands for Hue-Saturation-Value. "Hue" has a range of [0,2*PI] and "Saturation" has a range of [0,1], the two together represent the color. While "Value" has the same range as the input pixels and represents how light/dark the color is. Original algorithm taken from [1] and modified slightly. NOTE: The hue is represented in radians instead of degrees, as is often done. NOTE: Hue will be set to NaN if it is undefined. It is undefined when chroma is zero, which happens when the input color is a pure gray (e.g. same value across all color bands). RGB to HSV: min = min(r,g,b) max = max(r,g,b) delta = max-min // this is the chroma value = max if( max != 0 ) saturation = delta/max else saturation = 0; hue = NaN if( r == max ) hue = (g-b)/delta else if( g == max ) hue = 2 + (b-r)/delta else hue = 4 + (r-g)/delta hue *= 60.0*PI/180.0 if( hue < 0 ) hue += 2.0*PI [1] http://www.cs.rit.edu/~ncs/color/t_convert.html
